wikipedia_page.main: Evan Jones (born (1888-10-20)20 October 1888) was a Welsh international footballer. He was part of the Wales national football team between 1910 and 1914, playing 7 matches. He played his first match on 5 March 1910 against Scotland and his last match on 19 January 1914 against Ireland.

response: Born in Swansea, Wales, Thomas began his career with his hometown side Swansea Town. He made his debut for the club in the Southern Football League but struggled to establish himself in the first team and left the side in 1920, having made three league appearances. He instead joined Welsh League side Porth where he helped the team win the Welsh League title in 1922, having formed a forward partnership with Evan Jones.

*Evan Jones (missionary) (1820–1872), Baptist missionary to the Cherokees and leader of one group on the Trail of Tears
*Evan Jones (Farmers Alliance) (1846–1899), President of the Texas Farmers Alliance
*Evan Jones (Blue Heelers), fictional character from the Australian TV series Blue Heelers
*Evan Jones (Ieuan Gwynedd) (1820–1852), Welsh campaigner and journalist
*Evan Jones (Ifan y Gorlan), harpist, died in 1859 in Wales
*Evan Jones (author) for Rivers of America Series
*Evan Jones (rapper), American rapper from Miami, Florida
